lines.text: Take your pants off.
I don't even know your name.
Bend over.
Ben? Nice to meet you, Victor Hugo.

[Seeing Fletch walk by in an all white suit, with a limp]
This is a secure area!
Well I'm very happy for ya, most people live in terrible neighborhoods.
Are you the head honcho?
That's right sir, Headly Dan Duke, and what seems to be your problem.
The problem IS I agreed to take a shit load of that blue bird crap of your hands and it ain't come yet!
I'm very sorry sir, and you are...?
I ARE PISSED!
[reaches into his white jacket pocket and begins to pull out a fake invoice]
Some damn fool told me it was on back order and I'd have to wait!
[puts fake invoice directly in front of the managers face]
Who's signature is this? Who signed that?

[attempting to read something less than 1 inch in front of his face]
Well, I can't seem to ah...

[Fletch ripping the fake invoice from his hand]
Well that's the trouble. It's typical of a large corporation.
[stuffs the fake invoice back into his jacket]
Lack of communication and that's why I like to keep Everest small.
OH your from Everest?
Now you're talkin!
[expresses his dumbfounded look knowing he just sold the manager on the biggest and stupidest scam]
Elmer Gantry! Elmer Fudd Gantry.
Well, Mr Gantry I'm not sure there's anything I can do, uh...
Well you could pull my file instead of standing there pulling your pud!

[leans over to the assistant]
Pull the Everest file.
[Fletch limps away at this point]

[Fletch begins walking towards the shipping containers as a crash is heard and a man screams OOWWWWW. Mr Duke follows him]
I apologize for my benecosity. I've had a hernia operation. Is that the stuff I was supposed to get?
Yes sir.
Why are they wearing those funny suits?
Well, there protective as you know that's a very corrosive bi-product they're handling.
Oh yeah. I guess if they didn't wear those suites those boys would be so full of wholes they'd whistle when they walked! Hahahahaahahah, ow!

[laughs with Fletch until he cringes]
What's that...
Awe, i've been spittin up blood, pissing blood, bleedin. Go through five of these suits a day.

[Receives the Everest file from the assistant]
Well, it seems you have your facts wrong Mr. Gantry. Your company is supposed to get 1,500 gallons. Destination some place called Belle Isle in Louisiana. Signed for by an officer of your company and due the 23rd. So we're right, and you're wrong.

[rips a page from the Everest file]
Let me see that! It takes a big man to admit when he's wrong.
[folds the page and puts it in his jacket]
. I am NOT a big man.
Irwin, admit that you are a sinner.
Uh. Well, I've sinned. I didn't take any Polaroids or anything. But, yeah, I've sinned.
The Lord forgives ya!

Thank you. Thank you very much. Thank you. Thank you. Amen. What? Other sins? Uh, I parked in a handicap spot on my way up here. Actually, on a handicap person. I told him I'd be back in five minutes, so that's not such a big deal.
Becky was a good girl and didn't need to be spanked... dammit.
It takes a big man to admit when he's wrong. I am NOT a big man.
Folks ain't home. Cross won't burn. Hell, it ain't like it used to be.
What can I do to y- for you?

[narrating]
The Reverend Farnsworth was Becky's father, but I wasn't going to hold that against her. If I was going to hold anything against her, it certainly wouldn't be her father.
What do you mean, toxic waste?
Well, it's some special stuff. There's only eleven places in the country that makes this shit.
Where?... Frank, just give me the ones that aren't in New Jersey.
Uh, there's only one.

[narrating]
Figuring out that the guy who dropped my watch in the swamp was the same guy who stole it at the morgue didn't take Sherlock Holmes... Larry Holmes could've figured that one out.

[flirting]
Hey Betty, how about lunch at the In N' Out Burger?

[disgusted]
No.
Okay, forget the burger, how about just the In N' Out?
[she sneers at him]
Ok, how about just the In?
[Fletch, dressed as a nerdy businessman, has walked into a biker bar]
Name's Ed... Ed Harley.
Ed... you sure you're in the right place?
I think so!

[mocking]
Think so!
[all laugh]
Ed...
[frowning]
what are you doing in here?
I'll give you a hint... Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
[all stare]
You don't get it?

[grabs Fletch]
No, Ed... you're the one that doesn't get it.
Ed HARLEY. Harley-Davidson Motorcycles!

[shocked]
You own the company?
Well, my granddaddy started it, then my daddy screwed Davidson out of his half, and now I own the whole thing.

[really shocked]
Harley-Davidson, no shit?
No shit!

[smiling broadly]
Hey, everybody! Ed the Third here owns Harley-Davidson! We're the Nazis from Natchez!
[all cheer, embrace Fletch]
Name?
Ah... Irwin M Fletcher. Irwin Mahatma Fletcher.
Address?
Bobby Ross?
Huh?
Peter Lemonjello. Your house is on fire.
What?
They called and told me to tell you your house is on fire. I'm here to take over.
Well God bless you!
[man hurries out of the computer room]

[as man is leaving]
And god bless you for believing that shit.
How do you do? I be Calculus Entropy, you be Mr. and Mrs. Fletcher?
I be Fletch, Geometry Fletch. She be Miss Trigonometry Ross.
Our families go back for hundreds of years - your great-grandparents owned my great-grandparents and that's how it all started.
You ever heard of the Emancipation Proclamation?
Well I heard something about it, but I don't recall exactly. It didn't get too much publicity around these here parts.
I'll bet.
Should I be doing anything?

No, not really, um... as soon as you get that trunk upstairs and have finished your nap I guess you could fix that step and jump down, turn around and pick a bale of cotton. And while I'm gone see to it Miss Scarlet stays away from the Union army will you?
I borrowed your toothbrush. I would have used your razor but it looks like you've been doing some gardening with it.
So tragic when this happens to somebody so young and healthy. Was she feeling alright last night?
She felt great to me.

[touring BibleLand]
You don't suppose I used too many photographs of myself do you?
No, no. Worked for the Ayatollah.
Uh and you are...
I'm Claude Henry Carlton Smoot
Ca... ca... ca...
Claaaauuuuude Henry
Ca... ca... Carl...
Claude or Carl
Carl...
Smoot. Smoot. S-M-M-O-T-T. I'm sorry 2 O's, 1 T.
Smmoot.
I'm a guest healer.
...a guest healer...

[puts his hand on the man's forehead and presses forward]
Healed!
[laughs]
All I needed now was a computer. And a ten year old kid to teach me how to use it.
It's a championship Laker watch.
Oh, are you a Laker?
I used to date one - only thing I have to remember him by.

[Turbulence]
Oh Lord, what was that?
We just clipped a Piper Cub. Pilot's okay, I just saw him parachuting.
Uh, sir, this is a secure area.
Well, I'm very happy for you, son. Most people live in terrible neighborhoods.
